word: As time passed, and Elijah prepared for translation, so Elisha was prepared to become his successor. And again his faith and resolution were tested. Accompanying Elijah in his round of service, . . . he was at each place invited by the prophet to turn back. . . . As often as the invitation to turn back was given, his answer was, "As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee" (2 Kings 2:2). . . . For this work Elisha's early training under God's direction had prepared him.--Education, pp. 58-61.
